newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds rise, boosted by Menem speech.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds rise, boosted by Menem speech.

text.p: Argentine bonds rose early Thursday with the market boosted by statements by President Carlos Menem in New York late Wednesday.
"The comments were well accepted," said a trader at a foreign bank.
Menem stressed in his speech to investors that talk of corruption in Argentina has been exaggerated and that the justice system in the country is strong.
The dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 rose 0.14 to 122.44, while Argentina's FRB due 2005 advanced 3/8 to 86-7/8.

Another trader said the market was firm particularly when considering that it managed to shrug off a dip in U.S. Treasury prices. Trade was not very busy, but there were "bursts of activity" in the morning, he added.
